cab.content: [S DOCUMENT-IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT)SECRETCP.(51) 136 COPY NO, 3?/18TH MAY, 1951CABINETINFORMATION SERVICES COMMITTEESMINISTERIAL, RESPONSIBILITY AND COMMITTEE STRUCTURENote by the Secretary of the CabinetThe Prime Minister has decided that the Secretary of State for commonwealth Relations shall be responsible for the co-ordination ofinformation services, including general questions affecting the Press and theB.B.C., and that he shall be Chairman of two Ministerial Committees dealingwith Information Services at home and overseas.2. The existing Information Services Committee, which comprises both home and overseas Ministers, will be discontinued. In its place there willbe constituted two Ministerial Committees, one for Home information services and the other for Overseas Information Services.The Home Information Services Committee will have the following terms of reference"To keep under review the working of Government Information services in the United Kingdom; to co-ordinate, as required, the publicityprogrammes of the home Departments; and to consider such otherrelated problems as may be referred to it by the Cabinet. "The membership of the Committee will be as follows:-Secretary of State for Commonwealth Relations (In the Chair)Minister of Defence rPresident of the Board of trade minister of Labour and National ServiceMinister of Fuel and BwerMinister of FoodMinister of HealthPostmaster-general financial Secretary, Treasury.This Ministerial Committee will be "assisted by the existing HomeInformation Services (Official) Committee, which will retain its present constitution and terms of reference.3. The Overseas Information Services Committee will have thefollowing terms of reference:-"To keep under review Government publicity to countries overseas andthe working of Government Information Services overseas; and toconsider such other related problems as may be referred to it bythe Cabinet. " - The membership of the Committee will be as follows:-Secretary of State for Commonwealth Relations (In the Chair)Minister of defence secretary of State for the ColoniesParliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs(Mr. Ernest Davies).4. This Ministerial Committee will be assisted by an overseas information Services (Official) Committee under the Chairmanship ofMr. C.F.A. Warner (Foreign Office) and comprising officials of theColonial Office, Commonwealth Relations Office and Central Office ofInformation. The Treasury will nominate an official to attend meetings at which financial questions are to be discussed, and representatives ofother Departments and of the B.B.C. will be invited to attend as required.The terms of reference of the Overseas Information Services(Official) Committee will be:-"To keep under review Government publicity to countries overseas and the working of Government information services overseas;and to undertake such other tasks as may be assigned to it by the overseas Information Services Committee. "(Signed) NORMAN brook cabinet Office, S.W.1,18TH MAY, 1951.
